SEARCH
Package model

Class Piece

java.lang.Object
model.Piece
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Piece extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a single piece on the Gomoku board. Each piece knows its position, color, and its neighbors in 8 directions. Color codes: - 0: White (O) - 1: Black (X) Neighbor links enable directional traversal of the board.
Since:
2025-03-26

  • Constructor Details

    • Piece

      public Piece(int color, int row, int col)
      Constructs a new piece with a given color and position on the board.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the piece (0 = white, 1 = black)
      row - the row index (must be ≥ 0)
      col - the column index (must be ≥ 0)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if position is negative or color is invalid

  • Method Details

    • setNeighbor

      public void setNeighbor(Direction direction, Piece neighbor)
      Sets a neighboring piece in the specified direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction of the neighbor
      neighbor - the neighboring piece

    • getNeighbor

      public Piece getNeighbor(Direction direction)
      Gets the neighboring piece in the specified direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction to look in
      Returns:
      the neighboring piece, or null if none exists

    • getNeighbors

      public EnumMap<Direction,Piece> getNeighbors()
      Returns the map of all neighbors for this piece.
      Returns:
      EnumMap of Direction to Piece

    • hasNeighbor

      public boolean hasNeighbor(Direction direction)
      Returns true if there is a neighboring piece in the given direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction to check
      Returns:
      true if a neighbor exists, false otherwise

    • getColor

      public int getColor()
      Returns the color of the piece.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the piece. "O" for white (0), "X" for black (1).
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      "O" or "X" based on the color
